definition: long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point

sentences.english: By my rambling digressions I perceive myself to be grown old.
sentences.chinese: 依我絮叨离题的程度来看，我知道我的确老了。

sentences.english: And babble the same speech without need of meaning...
sentences.chinese: 不用含意却絮叨相同的言词。

sentences.english: On the way back, she told me a lot of hum about.
sentences.chinese: 回来的路上，她絮絮叨叨地跟我说了很多。

sentences.english: Long-winded descriptions are the death of many good speeches.
sentences.chinese: 絮絮叨叨的长篇大论是演讲的死穴。

sentences.english: He is forever croaking about his problems.
sentences.chinese: 他老是絮絮叨叨地说她的那些问题。

sentences.english: I love you more than gin rummy is a bore.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你超过酒鬼的絮叨。
难道你就从不絮絮叨叨吗？

sentences.english: I would have taken the time to listen to my grandfather  ramble about his youth.
sentences.chinese: 我会抽出时间听爷爷絮絮叨叨讲他年轻时的往事。

sentences.english: She chattered on and on about her new fur coat.
sentences.chinese: 提起她的新皮大衣，她就没完没了地絮叨起来。

sentences.english: I would have taken the time to listen to my grandfather ramble about his youth.
sentences.chinese: 我会抽出骼时间听爷爷絮絮叨叨讲他年轻时的往事。

sentences.english: The principal waffled on about exam results but no one was listening.
sentences.chinese: 校长絮絮叨叨地谈着考试结果，但是谁也没有听进去。

definition: long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to be chattersome/to talk on and on without stopping/to nag
to sound like a broken record/to prattle/to nag/to mutter
to chatter or jabber on and on
to talk about often/to reminisce about/to keep repeating/to keep harping on/to discuss
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
